fields.description: Block number 1 or 2

fields.name: sub-plot
fields.title: Sub-plot
fields.description: All plots divided into two sub-plots in 1974-1980 to test Mg. Sub-plots given Mg as a treatment excluded from the re-analysis in 1974 and 1979.  Thus sub-plot 12 is included (no Mg) but sub-plot 11 is excluded (+Mg).

fields.name: sample_year
fields.title: Year in which soil originally sampled
fields.description: Year in which soil originally sampled. Soil samples were generally taken in the autumn, after the current crop was harvested and before the soil was ploughed for the next harvest year, so that the soil properties could be related to the treatments applied in that harvest year. Archived dried soil re-analysed 27.03.2019.

fields.description: Depth of soil sampled. 12-20 cores were taken from the central section of each plot and combined to make one sample.

fields.name: exch_al
fields.title: Exchangeable Aluminium
fields.description: Exchangeable soil aluminium. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 0.33 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.name: exch_ca
fields.title: Exchangeable Calcium
fields.description: Exchangeable soil calcium. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 1.43 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.name: exch_cu
fields.title: Exchangeable Copper
fields.description: Exchangeable soil copper. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 0.02 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.title: Exchangeable Iron
fields.description: Exchangeable soil iron. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 0.23 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.name: exch_k
fields.title: Exchangeable Potassium
fields.description: Exchangeable soil potassium. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 3.18 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.name: exch_mg
fields.title: Exchangeable Magnesium
fields.description: Exchangeable soil magnesium. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 0.21 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.name: exch_mn
fields.title: Exchangeable Manganese
fields.description: Exchangeable soil manganese. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 0.06 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

fields.description: Exchangeable soil sodium. Measured in sieved (<2mm) air-dry soil extracted with 1 M ammonium nitrate. The cations were detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Detection limit 0.76 mg/kg; any negative values converted to zero.

resources.title: Soil data
resources.description: The main data table containing soil exchangeable cation data for archived soil sampled in 1964, 1967, 1974, 1979, 1983 and 1989, re-analysed in 2019. Topsoil was analysed from all plots and sub-plots (where present), except sub-plots given Mg in 1974-1978. Exchangeable cation extraction by ammonium-nitrate method. Cations were detected by ICP-OES. Any negative values were converted to zero.

name: rothamsted-long-term-liming-experiment-exchangeable-cations-re-analysed
title: Rothamsted long-term liming experiment exchangeable cations re-analysed
description:
### Abstract
The experiment tests the effects of different amounts of lime (and thus soil pH), P and K on a sequence of arable crops, on a silty clay loam soil at Rothamsted Experimental Farm, Harpenden, from 1962-1996. Archived topsoil samples from six years between 1964 and 1989  were re-analysed in 2019 for a range of soil exchangeable cations, by extraction with ammonium nitrate. There was a parallel experiment at Woburn Experimental Farm. 

This experiment was under grass from 1997-2019 and no treatments were applied. In April 2019 the experiment was revived, and is currently being used to investigate the effect of different lime, P and Zn treatments on macro and micro nutrient uptake of wheat varieties. For more details contact Dr SM Haefele.  

This dataset was partially funded by the BBSRC Institute Strategic Programme Soil to Nutrition (BBS/E/C/000I0310).
### Methods
Period 1 (1962-1980): four lime levels with and without fertilizer P and K. Period 2 (1981-1996): four lime levels with four P levels. 2 replicates (blocks). 
 -  Topsoil (0-18 or 0-23cm) sampled in 1964, 1967, 1974, 1979, 1983 and 1989
 - 12-20 soil cores taken from the central area of each plot and combined to make one sample
 - Soil samples taken in autumn, after harvest and before ploughing for the next crop
 - Archived air-dried sieved (<2mm) soils re-analysed in 2019. 
 - Exchangeable cations Al, Ca, Cu, Fe, K, Mg, Mn, Na and Zn, mg/kg dry soil
 - Measured by extraction with 1 M ammonium nitrate. 
 - Cations detected by ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer).
 - Negative values shown as zero.
### Technical Info

### Other
**Detection limits (DL) of the ICP-OES.** 
These values provide an indication of the lower values for detection by the ICP-OES. DL (mg/kg dry soil) is calculated as 3x standard deviation of blanks. 

|              |      Al         |       Ca        |       Cu       |       Fe      |       K       |        Mg      |       Mn     |      Na     |       Zn     |
|--|:--:|:--:|:--:|:--:|:--:|:--:|:--:|:--:|:--:|
|DL  | 0.33  | 1.43  | 0.02  | 0.23  | 3.18  | 0.21  | 0.06 | 0.76 | 0.02 |
### Provenance
The original archived soil samples were stored in the Rothamsted Sample Archive. The chemical analysis was carried out in the Analytical Unit of Rothamsted Research in 2019.
### Quality
The Analytical Chemistry Unit follows the Joint Code of Practice (JCoPR) and participates in European Quality Assurance programmes. All performance is strictly monitored using certified external standards alongside in-house standard materials. Standards and check samples are monitored and recorded.
